other_tests.findings: Ms. A scored 125 out of a possible 144, indicating mild dementia. Mr. B scored 135 out of a possible 144, also consistent with mild Alzheimer's disease.
Results were consistent with the diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease.
Dramatic improvement in Ms. A's mood and activity level was reported after starting treatment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two weeks later, her mood began to decline slightly, leading to an increase in dosage, with subsequent rapid improvement.

other_tests.findings: Mr. B did not show improvement despite being in the therapeutic range.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After switching to tranylcypromine, he reported being 'back to my former self' within 6 weeks, despite persistent cognitive deficits.
